channel.title: Variables :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: Declaring Variables Variables in C are declared exactly like variables in Java or C#. Just say: type name;where type is the type of the variable, and name is its name. The most common types in C are: int double float charNotice that C does not have a boolean type or a string type. Some examples: int num; char c; double val;Initializing Variables To initialize: name = value;Where name is the name of the variable, and value is the value you want to store in it.
